member.name: M:NanoXLSX.LowLevel.LowLevel.Save
member.summary: Method to save the workbook
member.exception: Throws IOException in case of an error
Throws an OutOfRangeException if the start or end address of a handled cell range was out of range
Throws a FormatException if a handled date cannot be translated to (Excel internal) OADate
Throws an StyleException if one of the styles of the workbook cannot be referenced or is null
member.remarks: The StyleException should never happen in this state if the internally managed style collection was not tampered.

member.name: M:NanoXLSX.LowLevel.LowLevel.SaveAsStream(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Method to save the workbook as stream
member.exception: Throws IOException in case of an error
Throws an OutOfRangeException if the start or end address of a handled cell range was out of range
Throws a FormatException if a handled date cannot be translated to (Excel internal) OADate
Throws an StyleException if one of the styles of the workbook cannot be referenced or is null
member.remarks: The StyleException should never happen in this state if the internally managed style collection was not tampered.

member.name: M:NanoXLSX.LowLevel.LowLevel.EscapeXmlChars(System.String)
member.summary: Method to escape XML characters between two XML tags
member.remarks: Note: The XML specs allow characters up to the character value of 0x10FFFF. However, the C# char range is only up to 0xFFFF. NanoXLSX will neglect all values above this level in the sanitizing check. Illegal characters like 0x1 will be replaced with a white space (0x20)

member.name: M:NanoXLSX.LowLevel.LowLevel.GeneratePasswordHash(System.String)
member.summary:
Method to generate an Excel internal password hash to protect workbooks or worksheets
This method is derived from the c++ implementation by Kohei Yoshida (http://kohei.us/2008/01/18/excel-sheet-protection-password-hash/)
member.remarks: WARNING! Do not use this method to encrypt 'real' passwords or data outside from NanoXLSX. This is only a minor security feature. Use a proper cryptography method instead.
member.param: Password string in UTF-8 to encrypt

member.name: M:NanoXLSX.LowLevel.LowLevel.GetOADateTimeString(System.DateTime,System.Globalization.CultureInfo)
member.summary: Method to convert a date or date and time into the internal Excel time format (OAdate)
member.param: CultureInfo for proper formatting of the decimal point
member.returns: Date or date and time as Number
member.exception: Throws a FormatException if the passed date cannot be translated to the OADate format
member.remarks: OA Date format starts at January 1st 1900 (actually 00.01.1900). Dates beyond this date cannot be handled by Excel under normal circumstances and will throw a FormatException

member.summary: Checks the format of the passed version string
member.exception: Throws a FormatException if the version string is malformed

member.name: M:NanoXLSX.Metadata.ParseVersion(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Method to parse a common version (major.minor.revision.build) into the compatible format (major.minor). The minimum value is 0.0 and the maximum value is 99999.99999
The minor, revision and build number are joined if possible. If the number is too long, the additional characters will be removed from the right side down to five characters (e.g. 785563 will be 78556)
member.exception: Throws a FormatException if the major number is too long or one of the numbers is negative

member.name: M:NanoXLSX.Style.Style.Append(NanoXLSX.Style.AbstractStyle)
member.summary: Appends the specified style parts to the current one. The parts can be instances of sub-classes like Border or CellXf or a Style instance. Only the altered properties of the specified style or style part that differs from a new / untouched style instance will be appended. This enables method chaining
member.param: The style to append or a sub-class of Style
member.returns: Current style with appended style parts
